attributes.action: offer Mr Harry Patch, born 17th June, 1898, of Wells, Somerset a Knighthood in recognition of his service to his Country in The First World War, and as the last surviving soldier who served in the Trenches on the Western Front
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mr Patch is one of the last remaining symbols of that great generation who bore such suffering. As he and the last other handful of veterans appear to have rejected a state funeral, a Knighthood for Mr Patch would be a suitable way to honour his and his comrades.
Such recognition would also honour the self sacrifice of men like Mr Patch and provide a role model for current and future generations

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.honours.gov.uk/
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
